title: Homemade Type Lights My Fire
content:
We are experimenting with "homemade" type. We made 1 letter out of 20 different materials, narrowed it down to 2 possibilities, and then made 4 more letters with the 2 best. My favorite of mine is made of matchboxes.

What do you think?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20A_4501.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20A%202_4656.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20C_5939.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20C%202_5423.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20O_5882.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20O%202_3572.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20X_6153.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130629004738im_/http:/typophile.com/files/match%20X%202_5219.jpg)

author: jftorres

comments.content:
Kinda cool, what's it for?

Guerrizmo+Design  
No man is an island unto himself\_John Donne

We are trying to be creative and learn how to make letterforms out of household objects. After creating the letters we brought them onto the computer and are currently refining them into cleaner forms.
